input.description: The name of the actor adapter. Default: CASDActor

This wrapper retrieves change records in the Service Desk system.
Sample Item XML:
<items> <item> <target> <soap-url>https://172.16.1.1:8443/axis/services/USD_R11_WebService?wsdl</soap-url> <host>172.16.1.1</host> <user-name>ServiceDesk</user-name> <password>password</password> <port>8443</port> <protocol>https</protocol> <allow-unsigned-certificate>true</allow-unsigned-certificate> <install-certificate>true</install-certificate> <passphrase>changeit</passphrase> </target> <change-number>110</change-number> <assignee>ServiceDesk</assignee> <created-by>Test</created-by> <group>Test Group</group> <closure-code>Successful with Errors</closure-code> <priority>1</priority> <risk>1-Extreme</risk> <is-active>true</is-active> <affected-end-user>ServiceDesk</affected-end-user> <requestor>ServiceDesk</requestor> <status>open</status> <category>Add.IT.Other</category> <is-template>true</is-template> <cab-approval>no</cab-approval> <cab>Test</cab> <impact>1-entire organization</impact> <summary>Test</summary> <description>des11</description> <business-case>b1</business-case> <backout-plan>test1</backout-plan> <business-justification>test</business-justification> <is-child>yes</is-child> <parent-change>22</parent-change <implementation-plan>Imp plan</implementation-plan> <root-cause>rootcause</root-cause> <sla-violation>false</sla-violation> <earliest-schedule-start-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-schedule-start-date> <latest-schedule-start-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-schedule-start-date> <earliest-schedule-end-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-schedule-end-date> <latest-schedule-end-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-schedule-end-date> <earliest-need-by-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-need-by-date> <latest-need-by-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-need-by-date> <earliest-open-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-open-date> <latest-open-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-open-date> <earliest-close-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-close-date> <latest-close-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-close-date> <earliest-resolve-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-resolve-date> <latest-resolve-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-resolve-date> <earliest-estimated-completion-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-estimated-completion-date> <latest-estimated-completion-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-estimated-completion-date> <earliest-actual-completion-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-actual-completion-date> <latest-actual-completion-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-actual-completion-date> <least-estimated-cost>1000</least-estimated-cost> <greatest-estimated-cost>2000</greatest-estimated-cost> <least-actual-cost>1000</least-actual-cost> <greatest-actual-cost>2000</greatest-actual-cost> <least-actual-duration>10:20:30</least-actual-duration> <greatest-actual-duration>10:20:30</greatest-actual-duration> <least-estimated-duration>10:20:30</least-estimated-duration> <greatest-estimated-duration>10:20:30</greatest-estimated-duration> <number-of-records>-1</number-of-records> <additional-search-arguments>close_date>12345678</additional-search-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameter Description:
items[Required] The parent tag that contains item details
item[Required] This tag contains the input data for individual item
target[Conditional] This tag contains the dynamic target configuration details for every item. This is required if adapter configuration is left empty.
soap-url[Optional] CA Service Desk web service SOAP url. Either "soap-url" or "host" should be specified for a valid dynamic target configuration. If both are provided "soap-url" takes precedence. Sample url format: https://<hostname>:<port>/axis/services/USD_R11_WebService?wsdl
host[Optional] Hostname or IP Address of server where CA Service Desk is installed. Either "soap-url" or "host" should be specified for a valid dynamic target configuration. If both are provided "soap-url" takes precedence.
user-name[Optional] User name required for authentication.
password[Optional] Password required for authentication.
port[Optional] Communication port for CA Service Desk application. Valid values - Any positive number greater than 0. Default value - 8080 for http, 8443 for https.
protocol[Optional] Communication protocol for CA Service Desk application. Valid values - http, https. Default value - https
install-certificate[Optional] Specifies if installation of certificates is desired. Valid values - true, false. Default value - false
allow-unsigned-certificate[Optional] Specifies if unsigned certificates need to be allowed. Valid values - true, false. Default value - false
passphrase[Optional] Password for authentication with the SSL certificate on the target server. Default value - changeit
change-number[Optional] The number of the change to be retrieved. Valid values - Valid change record id.
assignee[Optional] Contact name to whom the change is assigned. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
created-by[Optional] Contact name who created this change record. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
group[Optional] Group to which change record is assigned. Valid values - Valid group name
closure-code[Optional] Closure code of the change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
priority[Optional] Priority associated with the change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization to the default list of values is also supported.
risk[Optional] Risk associated with the change order. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization to the default list of values is also supported.
is-active[Optional] Specifies whether the change is active. Valid values - true, false
affected-end-user[Optional] Affected end user for the change record. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
requestor[Optional] Name of the requestor associated with the change record Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
status[Optional] Status of the change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
category[Optional] Category associated with the change. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
is-template[Optional] Specifies whether the change record is a template. Valid values - true, false
cab-approval[Optional] Specifies whether the change has cab approval. Valid values - yes,no
cab[Optional] CAB associated with the change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values.
is-child[Optional] Specifies whether the change record has a parent change assigned. Valid values - true, false
impact[Optional] Impact associated with this change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization done to the default list are also supported.
sla-violation[Optional] Specifies whether the change record has sla violation. Valid values - true, false
summary[Optional] Summary associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
description[Optional] Description associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
business-case[Optional] Business case associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
backout-plan[Optional] Backout plan associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
business-justification[Optional] Business justification associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
parent-change[Optional] Parent change associated with the change record. Valid values - Valid change id
root-cause[Optional] Root cause associated with the change record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
earliest-schedule-start-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with schedule-start-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-schedule-start-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with schedule-start-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
earliest-schedule-end-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with schedule-end-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-schedule-end-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with schedule-end-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
earliest-need-by-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with need-by-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-need-by-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with need-by-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
earliest-open-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with open-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-open-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with open-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
earliest-resolve-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with resolve-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-resolve-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with resolve-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
earliest-close-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with close-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-close-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with close-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
earliest-estimated-completion-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with estimated-completion-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-estimated-completion-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with estimated-completion-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
earliest-actual-completion-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with actual-completion-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-actual-completion-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with actual-completion-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
least-estimated-cost[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with estimated-cost greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - Any valid number
greatest-estimated-cost[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with estimated-cost less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - Any valid number
least-actual-cost[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with actual-cost greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - Any valid number
greatest-actual-cost[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with actual-cost less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - Any valid number
least-estimated-duration[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with estimated-duration greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - Duration in the format hh:mm:ss. For example - 10:20:30
greatest-estimated-duration[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with estimated-duration less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - Duration in the format hh:mm:ss. For example - 10:20:30
least-actual-duration[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with actual-duration greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - Duration in the format hh:mm:ss. For example - 10:20:30
greatest-actual-duration[Optional] If this value is provided then all change records with actual-duration less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - Duration in the format hh:mm:ss. For example - 10:20:30
implementation-plan[Optional] Implementation plan associated with the change record. Valid values - Any String value
number-of-records[Optional] Specifies the number of records to be retrieved. Default value = -1 (Retrieves all the records) Valid values - Number greater than 0. In any case a maximum of 250 records will be retrieved.
additional-search-arguments[Optional] Specifies the custom search query involving one or more attributes. Valid value - Refer to "Service Desk Application" and "Technical Reference Guide" for valid search query.

documentation.description: This wrapper retrieves change records in the Service Desk system.
